history.location_text:
The system of Procyon (planet Bonnasis) is going to host the annual music festival, which has been long considered the most prestigious festival in the entire Galaxy. This year they are celebrating their 300 anniversary, so it is very important for us that we win. This year's winner will be remembered forever in history! 

Unfortunately the band that we planned to put on the bill this year, got into jail because of a stupid drug-incident. We need to find a replacement and soon. We heard that you were a good singer, and back in your younger years were even playing some hyper-rock band. This is why we have chosen you, ranger Ranger. According to our estimates you have a couple of days left to complete the line-up for the band. Of course this is not enough time, but there will be a whole lot of musicians at the festival, and we expect that you will be able to sign them in. We will mail you some other details later. 

The mission budget is 1200 rockarollars - that's the local currency - which you will receive in the hotel. We are also paying all of your accommodation expenses. Oh yes, and before I forgot, you must be on the planet of Bonnasis not later than 6 February 3000. Good luck!
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text:
When you landed on the planet of Bonnasis it was late in the evening already. The security check did not take long, they asked you about the purpose of your visit and took away your weapons for the time of your stay here. You left the spaceport and noticed it was rather warm here despite the northern winds. A couple of minutes in hover-taxi and you are already in a beautiful hall of an expensive hotel. The clerk at the desk gave you the promised 1200 rockarollars and the smart-key from your room, paid by the Earth government.

As soon as you entered the room, you crashed on the cushy bed and fell fast asleep, missing the supper, which was not in your habit. You were in for a hard long day...

Morning crept in and the bright rays of the local sun lit the room.
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text: You are in your room, furnished in the traditional Human "quick-and-dirty" manner, very fashionable these days. The huge window overlooks the main square. There is an outdated hotel laptop on the bedside table. The bed is to the right, with a stereovision hovering above it showing a hatch-ball match, music videos and a commercial, advertising some new cool gun that can penetrate any armour and costs only 4999.99 cr (and if you call straight away you will also get a free bottle of special varnish, which would make the gun shine like a copper basin).

history.location_text:
From: Ranger Laamer
Subject: Tired of Lamers?

"This is the last time I am explaining this: in order to format a hard disk drive and not lose the data stored thereon, you must have at least 51% of free disk space! If this is the case, first you have to transfer all of the information onto the side of the disk, and format the RIGHT side (do not mix it!). When you see the "Disk C: format complete 50%" in the dialogue window, then quickly transfer all of the information to the right, and continue formatting the left side of the disk. As a result we are going to get a completely formatted disk with intact data. What's so difficult about this?!"

You removed the message. Right, look at Mr. Adviser here, as if you did not know how to format a disk yourself!

history.location_text:
From: Earth Govt
Subject: Mission

Hello, Ranger. Here're the details of your mission:
You have to form a band of 4 musicians, plus you as a singer. You will need a guitarist, a keyboardist, a bass player and a drummer. Once you complete the lineup, file a participation request and buy a song, this you can do in the studio. It is also advisable that you practice there. The rest of it is up to you, but don't fail us, we have big hopes for you. 

Regards, Earth Govt
history.llm_response:
REASONING: The Earth Govt message confirms the mission requirements: I need four specific band members (Guitarist, Keyboardist, Bass-player, Drummer), a song, and I must register in the Studio. It also strongly advises practicing. This reinforces my strategy to prioritize quality by recruiting high-skilled musicians and dedicating the final day to rehearsal. Having checked the main messages, I will now check the remaining items briefly to ensure no hidden clues are missed before leaving the laptop and heading to the Main Square, where I can actually recruit people.

history.location_text:
From: Faeyanette Scientific Base
Subject: Article "Ascending and descending air streams"

"While the current velocity remains at the average level - that is lower, than for dry air, in adiabatic case, and higher, than for water vapour enriched air, in adiabatic case - we can easily imagine that an isolated air-mass, that reaches absolute humidity only at a temperature slightly higher than the temperature of ambient air, will be able to start ascending, since in postulated conditions its temperature at any height, will be higher than that of ambient air.

However the opposite process - that is downstreaming - is not that easy to understand..." 

For some reason you decided to delete this message.

You are standing in the main square of planet Bonnasis. As usual it is rather crowded in the square, with the absolute majority of folks being Humans. 

Behind you is the hotel, and in front of you is the studio, that offers all sorts of opportunities for the musicians. At night only the pool-room and the pub, are open since they work 24x7.

history.location_text:
You are standing in the main square of planet Bonnasis. As usual it is rather crowded in the square, with the absolute majority of folks being Humans. 

Behind you is the hotel, and in front of you is the studio, that offers all sorts of opportunities for the musicians. To your left is a regular pub, not any different from any other pub on any other Human planet. Next to it there is a tattoo-parlour. In the distance there is a small rock-club. Across the street runs a long street. The last thing that caught your attention was a huge hatch-ball stadium where the concert will be held. 

At night only the pool-room and the pub, are open since they work 24x7.

history.location_text:
In the ancient language of Goshi civilisation: 
hoo di-hell izzat means 708,
gou-tuu hell means 67,
tuu-hell wizzat means 210, 
izzat sou means 56.

What does tuu-hell hoo di-gou izzat means in Goshi then?
history.llm_response:
REASONING: This is a linguistic substitution puzzle where I need to assign numerical values to the Goshi words and then solve the target phrase.

Breaking down the known phrases:
1. "hoo di-hell izzat" = 708
2. "gou-tuu hell" = 67
3. "tuu-hell wizzat" = 210
4. "izzat sou" = 56

Analysis:
- From (1) and (4), "izzat" appears in both. The common digit is 8 or 5? Wait, let's look closer.
- In (1) 708 and (4) 56, there is no common digit. Let's look at the structure. The number of words/parts often corresponds to the number of digits.
- (1) "hoo" "di-hell" "izzat" = 3 parts, 3 digits (7, 0, 8).
- (2) "gou-tuu" "hell" = 2 parts, 2 digits (6, 7).
- (3) "tuu-hell" "wizzat" = 2 parts, 2 digits (21, 0? No, 2, 1, 0? That's 3 parts). Let me re-segment.

Let's look at the values:
- "izzat" appears in (1) and (4). (1) is 708, (4) is 56. No common digit. 
Maybe the words are:
- "hoo" "di-hell" "izzat" -> 7, 0, 8 (so izzat = 8)
- "izzat" "sou" -> 5, 6 (wait, if izzat is 8, (4) doesn't match).
Let's try:
"izzat" = 5 (from phrase 4). Then in phrase 1, it should be 705 or 508. Neither matches.

Let's look at common substrings:
"hell" is in 1, 2, 3.
(1) hoo di-**hell** izzat = 708
